newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft, Object Design in pact.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft, Object Design in pact.

text.p: Microsoft Corp and Object Design Inc said Wednesday Microsoft has licensed Object Design's specialized software programming tools for Java, the Internet programming language.
Object Design said its ObjectStore PSE for Java is the only product to allow software program developers to embed a feature known as "persistent storage" in Java.

Persistent storage allows computer users to download Java applets from the Internet, work with the applets or mini-applications on their computers and store any changes they have made to data in the applets on their own computers.
The deal is expected to have little direct revenue impact for either company, a spokeswoman for Object Design said.

However, she said her company's full-blown ObjectStore database management system products stand to gain if Java, and by extension, Object Design's related software, become a familiar programming environment for Microsoft Windows.
Object Design shares had gained 2-21/32 to 15-1/4 by mid-morning Wednesday following release of the announcement.
Java is a programming language developed by Sun Microsystems Inc that is designed to simplify and speed the process of transmitting information and applications over the Internet.
Microsoft Corp and rival Netscape Communications Corp among others, have licensed Java from Sun for use in their own software systems.
